name: activated bentonite production | activated bentonite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4198/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of activated bentonite, which represents a mix of products, put together from the production processes of alkaline activated bentonite (38%), acid activated bentonite (61%) and catalytic converter (1%). Bentonite is an industrial mineral with a high content of swellable threelayer clay minerals, which originate mostly from the transformation of volcanic ashes and tuffs. Alkaline activated bentonite is used for the production of casting moulds, for various applications in the construction sector, for wine clarification and for paper recycling. Acid activated bentonite is mostly used for the production of bleaching earth and self-copying paper. This dataset is based on an environmental report of a German company (Süd-Chemie AG).;References:;Kellenberger D., Althaus H.-J., Jungbluth N., Künniger T., Lehmann M. and Thalmann P. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Building Products. Final report ecoinvent Data v2.0 No. 7. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

The activity starts when the raw materials enter the process.

This activity ends with the production of acid and alkaline activated bentonite (using two separate production processes). The production process of acid activated bentonite includes milling, activation, filtration/washing, milling, drying and storage. The production process of alkaline activated bentonite includes mixing, activation, grinding-drying, mixing/milling/granulation and storage. The dataset includes emissions to water, which is released into a river after treatment, as well as emissions to air.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is based on data from a German company.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Mix of different production processes for different products in one German plant: 61% acid activated bentonite, 38% alkaline activated bentonite and 1% catalytic converter.;References:;Kellenberger D., Althaus H.-J., Jungbluth N., Künniger T., Lehmann M. and Thalmann P. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Building Products. Final report ecoinvent Data v2.0 No. 7. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Environmental report of a German company (Süd-Chemie AG).

exchanges.description: Bentonite is an industrial mineral with a high content of swellable threelayer clay minerals, which originate mostly from the transformation of volcanic ashes and tuffs. Alkaline activated bentonite is used for the production of casting moulds, for various applications in the construction sector, for wine clarification and for paper recycling. Acid activated bentonite is mostly used for the production of bleaching earth and self-copying paper.

exchanges.description:
Literature data.

Reference: 
Süd-Chemie (1999) vereinfachte Umwelterklärung Bentonit 1999, Standort Moosburg. Süd-Chemie AG, München und Moosburg, D-80333 München.

Activity link: The original ecoinvent report for this datasets stated that "the bentonite factory is practically attached to the mine" (Kellenberger et al. 2007 - Part XIX, p.6). In addition, the diesel consumption in quarry operation and subsequent processing has remained the same as in the orginal ecoinvent v2 datasets. It is therefore assumed justifed to link the production of activated bentonite directly to the bentonite quarry operation through an activity link.

Reference:
Kellenberger D., Althaus H.-J., Jungbluth N., Künniger T., Lehmann M. and Thalmann P. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Building Products. Final report ecoinvent Data v2.0 No. 7. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH
